title: Do the Right Thing
creator_credit: 40 Acres and a Mule Filmworks, Universal Pictures, Wynn Thomas, Spike Lee and Ruth E. Carter
brief_description: Do the Right Thing is a 1989 American comedy-drama film produced, written, and directed by Spike Lee. The story explores a Brooklyn neighbourhood’s simmering racial tension, which culminates in violence and a death on a hot summer day.

constellations_other.name: Into a World of Colour
constellations_other.description: Filmmakers have been using colour as a method of storytelling since the first moving pictures. Colour can be used to signify emotion, intensify drama or to create a strong visual aesthetic.

creator_credit_for_label: 40 Acres and a Mule Filmworks, Universal Pictures, Wynn Thomas, Spike Lee and Ruth E. Carter
description: Salvatore “Sal” Fragione is the Italian owner of a pizzeria in Brooklyn. A neighborhood local, Buggin’ Out, becomes upset when he sees that the pizzeria’s Wall of Fame exhibits only Italian actors. Buggin’ Out believes a pizzeria in a black neighborhood should showcase black actors, but Sal disagrees. The wall becomes a symbol of racism and hate to Buggin’ Out and to other people in the neighborhood, and tensions rise.
